comments:
Got this while manually synchroniying a query on start up. Synchronization worked on the second attempt.

-- Error Log --

Severity: Error
Plugin ID: org.eclipse.core.jobs

Marking minor since only initial synchronization fails.  

Steffen: please post if this happens regularly.
I assume this isn't a regular occurrence? Marking worksforme.
It hasn't happened again so far.
I saw this once recently, though not on startup (but perhaps when first connecting to an SSL repository).  Will comment here if I see it again.

It hit again on startup with latest dev snapshot.

java.lang.IllegalStateException: SSLContextImpl is not initialized

I just realized that this time it was JIRA causing the error.
*** Bug 174868 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 176008 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Created an attachment (id=60079)
Fix race condition in context initialization

There is a potential race condition in the context initialization code. I think we can safely use a shared instance that is initialized in a static block. I have uncommented the global protocol registration in WebClientUtil since it is installed via the host configuration anyways.
Rob, please disregard the changes to WebClientUtil. The host configuration seems to be ignored. We definitely need more tests for this :).
Interesting idea. Patch applied. Excluded changes to WebClientUtil. Since this is intermittent I'll reassign to you now Steffen and will keep an eye out.
I consider this bug fixed. The SSL factory needs some cleanup though: bug 177866.
Fyi, I used to see this regularly, but have not seen it for some time now.
